{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the patient's clinical presentation and laboratory findings, she likely has Cushing's syndrome. The elevated serum cortisol levels, low ACTH levels, and lack of suppression with high dose dexamethasone suggest an adrenal source of excess cortisol production. The next step in management would be to localize the source of excess cortisol production. The most appropriate test for this would be an MRI of the adrenal glands (choice A). This would help identify any adrenal tumors or nodules that may be causing the excess cortisol production.", "answer_choice": "A"}
